meanings.sent1: The manager is manning the new project with skilled employees.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys manning the reception desk at the office.
meanings.sent3: The robots joked about manning the assembly line themselves.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to manning the team made him a valuable asset.
meanings.sent5: Manning the event with enthusiastic volunteers ensured its success.

meanings.definition: To take charge of a task or responsibility
meanings.sent1: John will be manning the grill at the barbecue this weekend.
meanings.sent2: Who will be manning the ticket booth at the fair?
meanings.sent3: The cat insisted on manning the task of guarding the house.
meanings.sent4: She bravely manned the helm of the ship during the storm.
meanings.sent5: Manning the cleanup effort after the party was a big job.

meanings.definition: The act of operating or controlling a machine or vehicle
meanings.sent1: His expertise in manning the forklift impressed his colleagues.
meanings.sent2: The captain's skill in manning the ship through rough waters was commendable.
meanings.sent3: The toddler pretended to be manning a spaceship in his cardboard box.
meanings.sent4: She took pride in manning the control panel of the aircraft.
meanings.sent5: Manning the steering wheel of the car, she navigated through the busy streets.
